titleStmt.title: J. Stuart to James F. Robinson
CWG8900

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: about four years ago Webb. & Webb were fined here two hundred Dollars for suffering gaming on their Wharf Boat, The Game for which they were fined was a game of Euchre by four persons who were waiting for a Packett at which drinks were bet. there was no intimation that they ever suffered any other Game

Since the fine was assessed one of the Defts Capt. Geo W Webb. raised a Company here for the 12th Cavalry & died in the service from exposure following Morgan, he left a Widow & family of small children & a nominal estate The other Deft Peter A Webb is a young man with little means & cant make any on account that he with several of us has had for near a year to be continually on the alert to resist Guerillas that have continually menaced this place the truth is the Government has left this place to look out for itself & I expect we will several of us be cleaned out before another Winter I think this fine ought to be remitted if any ever should have been. Will you be kind enough to do it. Obtly &c

Meade Cir. Ct
Pettn of Judge Stuart to remit fine of Webbs
$200 } Gaming
Remitted in full
J F Robinson
Issd July 2. 1863
Send to Judge S.
